meanings.definition: To sweeten or make more palatable.
meanings.sent1: I edulcorated my tea with a spoonful of honey.
meanings.sent2: She edulcorated the bitter medicine with a sprinkle of sugar.
meanings.sent3: The chef edulcorated the spicy curry to suit the taste of the guests.
meanings.sent4: Her smile edulcorated the atmosphere of the room.
meanings.sent5: The music edulcorated the air with its soothing melody.

meanings.definition: To make less harsh or severe.
meanings.sent1: The teacher edulcorated her criticism with words of encouragement.
meanings.sent2: He edulcorated the punishment by reducing the fine.
meanings.sent3: The comedian edulcorated the serious topic with humor.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness edulcorated the tough situation.
meanings.sent5: The rain edulcorated the scorching heat of the day.
